bibl.title: Letter from Algernon Rose to the Executors of Henry Rose Carter, December 7, 1925

div1.p: Rose expresses the regret of the Authors' Club of London on learning of Carter's death.

div1.head: Letter from Algernon Rose to the Executors of Henry Rose Carter, December 7, 1925
div1.opener:
Authors' Club.
(Founded 1891: Re-constructed 1908).
GENERAL COUNCIL.
President-- THOMAS HARDY, O.M, LL.D.
JOHN AYSCOUGH
RT. HON. SIR D. PLUNKET
BARTON, Bt., K.C.
ARNOLD BENNETT
POULTNRY BIGELOW
SIR EDWARD BRABROOK, C B.
RT. HON. VISCOUNT BURNHAM
C.H., D. Litt. &c.
SIR HALL CAINE, K.B.E., C.H,
W. L. COURTNEY, LL.D.
REV. CANON A. C. DEANE.
REV. P. H. DITCHFIELD, F.S.A.
SIR ARTHUR CONAN DOYLE, LL.D.
THE LORD DUNSANY.
C. B. FRY
MORICE GERARD
FRANCIS GRIBBLE
SIR ANTHONY HOPE HAWKINS
C. LEWIS HIND.
C. J. CUTCLIFFE HYNE.
SIR ERNEST KILPIN, K.C.M.G.
SIR GODFREY LAGDEN, K.C.M.G.
SIR OLIVER LODGE, F.R.S.
COMPTON MACKENZIE, O.B.E.
RT. HON. GEN. SIR F. NEVIL
MACREADY, Bt., G.C.M.G., K.C.B.
CHARLES MARRIOTT.
DR. J. MORGAN DE-GROOT.
RT. HON. SIR GILBERT PARKER,
Bt., P.C., LL.D., D.C.L., Litt.D.
SIR ALEXANDER RICHARDSON.
MORLEY ROBERTS.
RT. HON. SIR J. RENNELL RODD.
G.C.B., G.C.M.G., &c.
THE EARL OF RONALDSHAY,
G.C.S.I., G.C.I.E.
REV. A. H. SAYCE. D. Litt. &c.
H. DE VERE STACPOOLE.
HALLIWELL SUTCLIFFE.
THE LORD TENNYSON. G.C.M.G.
Litt.D.
COL. SIR EDWARD T. THACKERAY.
K.C.B., V.C.
HORACE ANNESLEY VACHELL.
E. H. LACON WATSON
PERCY WHITE.
LUCIEN WOLF.
SIR FRANCIS YOUNGHUSBAND.
K.C.S.I., K.C.I.E., D.Sc.
SIR T. CATO WORSFOLD, Bt., LL.D., D.L. (Hon. Solicitor).
EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE (1925-26).
RT. HON. SIR GILBERT PARKER, BT. LL.D., D.C.L., Litt.D. (Chairman)
FRANCIS GRIBBLE. (Deputy Chairman).
ALDER ANDERSON.
THOMAS COBB.
HOLLOWAY HORN.
H. C. PLUMMER, F.R.S.
ERNEST H. SHORT.
EVERARD WYRALL.
A. POMEROY-CRAGG, J.P. (Hon. Librarian).
ALGERNON ROSE (HON. SECRETARY).
CHEQUES SHOULD BE MADE OUT TO “FINANCIAL SECRETARY, AUTHORS' CLUB,” AND CROSSED
BANK OF LIVERPOOL, & MARTIN'S LTD.
TELEPHONE VICTORIA 3160 (12 LINES.)
TELEGRAMS: “AZYRITES, (PARL.) LONDON.”
CABLES: “AZYRITES LONDON”
2. Whitehall Court,
London, S.W.l.
Dec. 7, 1925.
The Executors of the late Dr. Henry Rose Carter,
2121, California Street, N.W.,
WASHINGTON D.C., U.S.A.
Dear Sirs,
div1.p:
We have received a copy of the International Health
Board Bulletin of October, 1925, intimating the death of Dr.
Henry Rose Carter, who was elected a member of the Authors' Club
in 1923. Thiese isare the first tidings we have received of this sad
occurrence, and at the next meeting of the Committee a formal
resolution of sympathy will be passed with his next-of-kin,
and recorded in the books of the Club.

I beg that you will be good enough to convey, in
advance, this expression of our regret at the loss of so distin-
guished a member of the Authors' Club as was Dr. Carter.
Executors of the late Dr. Carter.

The facts which are given in the obituary notice of
his death in the “Bulletin” are very much appreciated, and will be
placed in the archives of the Club.
div1.closer:
On behalf of the Committee, I am,
Yours truly, Algernon Rose. Hon. Secretary.
